content.body: https://github.com/tc39/how-we-work/blob/main/host.md
neat
man, "give me all of the own enumerable string + symbol keys of this object" is a _surprisingly_ annoying task for something I want to do pretty often
content.formatted_body: man, "give me all of the own enumerable string + symbol keys of this object" is a surprisingly annoying task for something I want to do pretty often

let desc = Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors(obj);
return [...Object.getOwnPropertyNames(desc), ...Object.getOwnPropertySymbols(desc)]
  .filter(x => desc[x].enumerable);

is the best I've got

content.body: do you figure we could add get away with making `Object.keys`/`entries` take a options bag argument like `{ symbols: true }`
content.formatted_body: do you figure we could add get away with making Object.keys/entries take a options bag argument like { symbols: true }

content.body: alternative I guess is a `Object.symbolKeys` / `Object.symbolEntries` so you could at least do `[...Object.keys(x), ...Object.symbolKeys(x)]`
content.formatted_body: alternative I guess is a Object.symbolKeys / Object.symbolEntries so you could at least do [...Object.keys(x), ...Object.symbolKeys(x)]

content.body: `Reflect.ownKeys` doesn't do it?
* `Reflect.ownKeys` + a filter doesn't do it?
(also why would you use gOPN if you want only enumerable? that's what keys already gives you)
wasn't that sort of the point, that symbols are supposed to be pseudo-private so it should be annoying to reflect over them?
ljharb: keys is strings only
or was that just a compat decision?

> <@ljharb:matrix.org> `Reflect.ownKeys` + a filter doesn't do it?

that's `Reflect.ownKeys` an improvement on using `getOwnPropertyNames` + `getOwnPropertySymbols`, sure
